TopicTitle: How to check FPS in KSP without any tools?

Articles.Content: Hi, using an OS X based system and you know, there's no program to show FPS in-game I just want to show my KSP FPS without using any program. Can I access a console of game engine in KSP? Thanks.
On linux i use a mod : http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/220663-showfps

On linux i use a mod : http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/220663-showfps

Can you help me about installation? Where I have to install the files? ShowFPS file or only source file into GameData didn't work

Can you help me about installation? Where I have to install the files? ShowFPS file or only source file into GameData didn't work

The install is the same as all other mods.

You just need to have this file: Kerbal Space Program/GameData/ShowFPS/ShowFPS.dll

And after press F11 to have the fps in game.

The install is the same as all other mods.

You just need to have this file: Kerbal Space Program/GameData/ShowFPS/ShowFPS.dll

And after press F11 to have the fps in game.

Thank you very much. But didn't work on OS X. I should try to run Fraps on Wine.

Fraps doesn't work too. Waiting for solution if anyone knows.

Edited June 26, 2014 by TYRT

I don't use a Mac, so i'm not exactly very familiar with OS X; would this app work though?: http://www.macupdate.com/app/mac/30533/atmonitor

I think it can record your FPS during a game, so you don't have to run it in windowed mode or anything.
